byline.original: By BILL VLASIC and MARY M. CHAPMAN

abstract: United Automobile Workers officials announce finalization of new labor contracts with General Motors, Ford Motor and Fiat Chrysler; agreements, set to expire in four years, were approved by workers after five months of difficult negotiations and contentious ratification votes.
lead_paragraph: The new contracts, which were finalized after a painstaking process, include raises and bonuses for all unionized workers and provide a path for newer employees to eventually achieve wage parity with veteran workers.

headline.main: U.A.W. Vote at Ford and G.M. Ends Painful Process for Big Three
headline.print_headline: Union Vote at Ford and G.M. Ends Painful Process for Big Three

snippet: The new contracts, which were finalized after a painstaking process, include raises and bonuses for all unionized workers and provide a path for newer employees to eventually achieve wage parity with veteran workers.
